result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Landon J. Ruehlow

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 14CF150, 14CF174 & 14CF232 called together at 2:31 pm [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for FSSC)
Defendant Landon J. Ruehlow in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Rhiel indicates that he has inadvertantly submitted an older CCS form, submits more recent form
off-record: 2:41 - 3:00 pm for Counsel to discuss free-to-argue/stipulated agreement
Counsel indicate that they are ready to proceed with plea/sentencing. DA Happ clarifies that modified CCS is more specific re: contact & reducing frequency of random urinalyses which are both beneficial to Mr. Ruehlow
On Motion of the State, the Court strikes the "on/near school enhancers" on Ct#1-14CF174 & Ct#3-14CF150

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "Guilty" entered on Ct#1-14CF174 & Ct#3-14CF150; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant  guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 14CF232

On Count #1-14CF174 & Count #3-14CF150, the Court sentences Mr. Ruehlow to 6 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 3 years and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 years, each count, concurrent. This sentence is IMPOSED & STAYED and the Court places the Defendant on Probation for 3 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--serve 6 months in Jefferson County Jail, each count, concurrent, with Huber/Work-Release privileges for purposes of employment, drug & alcohol treatment and family care; to commence March 1, 2015 by 6:00 pm
--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without controlled substances in system; non-compliance will result in loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--Random urinalyses (not less than once per month for the first 3 months)
--No Contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes as approved by Agent (Valerie Jannke is excepted from this restriction unless agent determines that contact between Ms. Jannke and the Defendant is couterproductive to defendant's rehabilitation based on subsequent actions of the defendant and/or Ms. Jannke.)
--To obtain/maintain employment and/or education program or combination of the two
--No possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--Take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--No contact with Jose Ramirez (dob: 7/20/87)
--No possession of any hypodermic needles unless medically necessary and with agent approval
--No possession/consumption of alcohol
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--To reimburse $300 buy money reimbursement ($150 each count)
--To pay costs of $536 ($268 each count)
--To pay $500 DNA Surcharge ($250 each count)
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand (14CF150)
APPLY CASH BOND

If revoked, The Court orders that conditions of probation become conditions of extended supervision
If revoked, The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
If revoked, The Court gives 1 day credit for time already served- each case

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess: 3:40 pm
Scheduling Order
Jury trial on December 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on December 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Scheduling Notice

Cases 14CF150, 14CF174 & 14CF232 called together at 8:43 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Landon J. Ruehlow in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. DA Susan V. Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Rhiel: Have been discussions on settlement on all 3 cases, not there yet. Requests matters be set on trial calendar while negotiations continue. Cases 14CF150 & 14CF174 are related, involves same witnesses-cases could be tried together. 14CF232 is not related, would not try that with other cases.
DA Happ: Agreed, requests trial be set out approx. 60 days. If agreement is reached, will get date in advance of trial dates.
Court informs parties that It is inclined to set all matters for same date/time for trial. Counsel agree
Upon questioning of the Court, Counsel agree preliminary hearing has already been waived in all three cases
Court agree 1 day will be needed for trial
Court reminds Mr. Ruehlow that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect as long as cases are pending. Court informs Mr. Ruehlow that the last date to enter plea in all matters is the 12/2/14 FSSC date.
Atty Rhiel addresses possible issue re: delay in filing. 
Recess: 8:52 am 

NEXT: ALL CASES - (1) Schedule FSSC on 12/2/14 at 1:30 pm - Send notices (2) Schedule JT on 12/8/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Status conference on September 30, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Notice

Cases 14CF150, 14CF174 & 14CF232 called together at 9:58 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Landon J. Ruehlow in court. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Rhiel: Have not been able to talk extensively with DA Happ in these matters, will be filing motion & memorandum re: filing of complaint, but do need some time to file. Issue does not exist in 14CF232, but request it trail along. Motions on these matters will likely be dispositive.
Court continues bond
Recess: 10:00 am 

NEXT: ALL CASES: (1) Schedule STC 9/30/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
State's (with cover letter)
Attorney Rhiel
Status conference on September 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 27, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Scheduling Notice

Cases 14CF150, 14CF174 & 14CF232 called together at 8:38 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Landon J. Ruehlow in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Ruehlow waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Atty Rhiel requests matter be set for DA PTC & STC
Court reminds Defendant that bond/conditions of bond remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 8:44 am 

NEXT: ALL CASES: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 8/27/14 at 11:00 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 9/12/14 at 10:00 am - Send notices
Preliminary hearing on August 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling Notice

Cases 14CF150, 14CF174 & 14CF232 called together at 10:18 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Landon J. Ruehlow in court with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

14CF150 & 14CF174: On State's Motion to Modify Bond: 
Arguments presented by Counsel

14CF150: Court presents basis and grants motion to modify bond and requires a $500 CASH bond, with conditions:
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Valerie Jannke
-No further violations of the law
-No possession of controlled sustances without a valid prescription

14CF174: Court presents basis and grants motion to modify bond and requires a $500 CASH bond, with conditions:
-No discussion of the facts of the case with Valerie Jannke
-No further violations of the law
-No possession of controlled sustances without a valid prescription

AS TO ALL CASES:
Court/Counsel discuss scheduling
off-record: 10:31 - 10:32 for Atty Rhiel to discuss scheduling with client
Statements by Mr. Ruehlow regarding bond modification
Court denies further modification of bond
Recess: 10:36 am 

NEXT:  ALL CASES (1) Schedule Preliminary Hearing 8/8/14 at 8:30 am - Send notices
Criminal complaint w/original signatures

ADDRESS INFO for Landon J. Ruehlow
Current: 1132 River Dr, Watertown, WI 53094 United States  (Effective: 07-11-2014)
Prior: 504 S. 7th St, Watertown, WI 53094
Status conference on July 25, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 23, 2014 at 10:40 am.
Probable cause statement
Scheduling notice

Case called at 1:16 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Landon J. Ruehlow appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney John Vernon Rhiel. Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Rhiel indicates that he has been appointed on this case.

Service of Complaint admitted; DOB confirmed accurate; Mr. Ruehlow indicates that the address on the complaint is not correct, but that he does not know what his address is as he just moved; charges/penalties recited; reading waived
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient
Bond arguments by Atty Flint
Court addresses possible conflict regarding 2002 CF case, finds no conflict, will hold balance nice, true & clear. No need to disqualify or recuse itself
Bond arguments by Atty Rhiel

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions:
-Provide updated address in writing within 48 hours 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
-No possession of drug paraphernalia to include needles and syringes unless needed for valid medical condition

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 
Recess: 1:32 pm 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 7/23/14 at 10:40 am  - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 7/25/14 at 10:00 am - Send notices
